descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.
Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: Dirk Nowitzki scored 21 points to lead Dallas to a 111-82 victory over the Golden State Warriors on Saturday night, the Mavericks' fifth win in six games.
article.headline: Nowitzki heats up, Mavs crush Warriors
article.linkText: Jamison scoreless as Mavericks rout Warriors
article.story:
OAKLAND, Calif. (AP) -- Scoring usually comes naturally for Dallas' Dirk Nowitzki and Golden State's Antwan Jamison. Both players struggled Saturday night, but Nowitzki rebounded from a slow start to score 21 points and lead the Mavericks to a 111-82 victory over the Warriors. Michael Finley recorded his first double-double of the season with 14 points and 10 rebounds as the Mavericks beat Golden State for the 11th straight time, including the last five in Oakland. Steve Nash scored 13 points and Juwon Howard 11. "We looked sharp on defense, and when we do that we're able to get our running game going," said Nowitzki, who missed five of his first seven shots, but finished 9-for-18 from the field in 25 minutes. "We were hitting a lot of shots in the second half." Jamison, who scored 23 of his 32 points in the first quarter against Dallas on Tuesday, missed all of his 11 shots and was held scoreless for the first time this season. "I got good looks too," said Jamison. "Of the 11 shots, only three were bad. I don't know what happened, unfortunately I didn't hit the shots. Maybe I wasn't focusing like I should." Danny Fortson had 17 points and 11 rebounds for the Warriors, who have lost three straight and five of six. Erick Dampier added 12 points, and Chris Mills scored 11. Jamison was averaging a team-high 23.3 points over his last three games. "First of all, he's got to be a little off," said Dallas coach Don Nelson. "We did play him as well as we could play him. We did get good support when he had us beat, but a guy like Jamison is going to get off in the course of the game no matter how well you play him." Dallas used a 17-2 third-quarter run to take a 20-point lead. The Mavericks outscored the Warriors 39-18 in the quarter. "They had a great game against us last time at our place," Nowitzki said. "We had a tough time there, and at the end we found a way to stop them. Today we were able to play a little better." Nowitzki and Finley combined for 15 points in the period. "They pressured us and took us out of our sets," Warriors' coach Dave Cowens said. "We couldn't make a play. We missed all our shots -- free throws, three's. We couldn't loosen them up." Dallas shot 63 percent (15-of-24) in the third quarter. The Warriors shot 35 percent (8-of-23). "We did a great job defensively and we're tough to beat when we do that," Nash said. "That's the key. When we play defense, we have a great chance to make a run at a team." The Mavericks led by at least 27 points in the fourth quarter, and pushed their lead to 35 points. Dallas used a 10-0 run late in the first half to take a 48-40 lead at the break.

Game notes
Tim Hardaway, who spent the first 6 1/2 years of his career with Golden State, received a warm ovation when he entered the game for the first time with 1:51 left in the first quarter. .. The Warriors last beat Dallas on April 10, 1999. ... The Mavericks are undefeated (7-0) this season when scoring 100 or more points. ... Adonal Foyle missed seven of eight free throws, all in the first half. ... The Warriors lost three straight for the first time this season. ... Nowitzki is averaging 29.6 points in his last five games.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
